Job Title: Maintenance Manager

Location: Chicago, IL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing, Production

Description:
LHH Recruitment Solutions has partnered with a growing organization, and they are seeking a Maintenance Manager to join their team in Chicago, IL. The Maintenance Manager will lead the maintenance team and oversee all aspects of maintenance operations within the plant facility. You will be responsible for managing a team of maintenance technicians, ensuring the effective implementation of maintenance programs, and driving continuous improvement initiatives. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 3 years of maintenance leadership experience, knowledge of CMMS (Computerized Maintenance Management System), experience with Plant Improvement Projects, and familiarity with LEAN and Kaizen/5S methodologies. Bilingual proficiency in Spanish and experience in food manufacturing are advantageous. Competitive Salary and Benefits Package (PTO, Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance) are offered. 
Key Responsibilities:and manage the maintenance team, including hiring, training, scheduling, and performance management.and implement maintenance strategies, policies, and procedures to optimize equipment reliability, minimize downtime, and reduce maintenance costs.CMMS to schedule and track maintenance activities, prioritize work orders, and ensure timely completion of tasks.with cross-functional teams to plan and execute plant improvement projects, utilizing CAD knowledge for design and implementation.LEAN principles and Kaizen/5S methodologies to drive continuous improvement in maintenance processes and efficiency.regular inspections of equipment and facilities to identify maintenance needs, safety hazards, and opportunities for optimization.and manage the maintenance budget, including forecasting expenses, controlling costs, and evaluating spending against budgetary targets.a culture of safety, quality, and accountability within the maintenance team, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements and company policies.effectively with internal stakeholders and external vendors to coordinate maintenance activities, procure parts and supplies, and address maintenance-related issues.updated on industry trends, best practices, and technological advancements in maintenance management and implement relevant improvements.
Qualifications and Skills:degree in Engineering, Mechanical/Electrical Engineering, or related field preferred.of 3 years of Maintenance Leadership experience in a manufacturing environment.in CMMS (Computerized Maintenance Management System) software for maintenance planning and scheduling.experience implementing plant improvement projects.with LEAN principles and Kaizen/5S methodologies for continuous improvement.proficiency in Spanish is preferred.in food manufacturing is a plus.leadership and management skills with the ability to motivate and develop a diverse team.problem-solving and decision-making abilities, with a focus on driving results and achieving operational objectives.communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams and external stakeholders.
If you are a passionate Maintenance Manager looking for a new and rewarding career, please apply today! You don’t want to miss out on this opportunity! 
LHH is a leader in permanent recruitment—and in the placement of top talent. Our areas of specialty include office administration, customer service, human resources, and supply chain and logistics. Please feel to check us out and apply for other opportunities if this role isn’t a perfect match.
Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled To read our Candidate Privacy Information Statement, which explains how we will use your information, please visit https://www.lhh.com/candidate-privacy/

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
